website_summaries.verdict: Overall, wide-footers may want to skip this shoe as there are many users who experience pain and blistering especially when the sizing isn’t right. However, players on whose feet the ClutchFit Drive II fit well find that the traction, cushion, and support mechanisms perform very well.This Under Armour basketball shoe is for guards because it prioritizes speed and agility. Impact protection and responsiveness is minimal yet you get a ton of court feel.
pros: The shoe generally receives good user feedback
One comments, “Traction, cushion, stability and lockdown are amazing
This is probably the best all arounder I've played with in a long time.”
Most of the users are pleased with the shoe’s traction
They say that the grip is reliable and consistent–allowing them to stop and go when needed
A number of players commended the shoe’s durability, saying that after one season, the ClutchFit Drive 2 maintained its great fit, comfort, and look

Given that it is of the right size, a lot of users comment that the Under Armour ClutchFit Drive 2 is very comfortable to wear since the shoe’s upper and ankle collar are padded with thick foam, and the insole is Micro G. One wearer comments, “it almost feels like a sock because the tongue and inside padding are extremely thick, soft and cradle the foot.”
The shoe’s upper padding and the narrow fit offer great support and lockdown, say most of the testers
It is as good as the Kevin Durant 11th Nike basketball shoe
A few purchasers like that there are many colors to choose from
cons: A lot of wearers say that the shoe runs very narrow from the midfoot to the forefoot
Because of this, a lot experience pain and blistering on their toes and forefoot
Due to the thick materials used on the ClutchFit Drive 2’s upper, a few players say that the shoe gets hot after just a few hours of playing
Several remark that they find the shoe too stiff and firm, further saying that they would’ve wanted the shoe to be a bit more comfortable
Many players complain about the heel cup underneath the ankle, saying that whenever they did tight cuts on the court, the TPU piece digs into their ankles
“It actually ripped the skin”, shares one user
“Cut gashes into my ankles every time I play”, says another one
A number of purchasers have issues with the shoe’s durability
After playing in the ClutchFit Drive II for a few weeks, some experience tearing on the sides of the shoes and on the mesh areas as well

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality shoe
customer_reviews.text: My husband goes threw shoes and we have been buying under armor for yrs and these fit well good ankle support and so far so good. He is a delivery driver so on his feet for 14 hrs a day Monday threw friday and he also wears them on weekends. If your looking for a good shoe this one is it. It is a bit narrow so if u have super wide feet id go up a half size. My husband has wide feet but likes his shoes snug fit.
customer_reviews.author: alisha

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great support, great cushioning, good grip! Worth more than what i paid for l! But u must buy a half size up!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but runs a little small. Overall excellent quality.
customer_reviews.text: I'm usually a 10.5, sometimes an 11, but I had to go all the way up to 11.5 on these things to have them fit. Regardless, a great pair of shoes and am happy I went with the blue. The other colors were too flamboyant and I actually returned a pair of red and blue ones for this reason. I would highly recommend these shoes. They are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Narrower than expected! Way too tight! Also shoes arrived with dirty soles!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 11.5 (us). Heel to Toe length seemed fine. But width is too narrow. So tight felt like cutting off circulation! Also it was hard to get my foot in the shoe. So size if definitely off! So order up .5 or 1 size! Was going to order a 12 (us) but they are not in stock! Bummer. Shoe looks and feels really nice except for the width. Also another thing that upset me the most was the soles were dirty like they have been worn! So did I get a used pair of shoes? These were most likely returns! Amazon check your returned products before you resell them! So these will be going back Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: A P

customer_reviews.title: He says they fit and feel great and aren't too heavy
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are much more attractive than in the images. The shoe is a shiny (but not too shiny) metallic silver and neon yellow that my 11 year old loves. He says they fit and feel great and aren't too heavy. He's been wearing them for a while now with almost daily gym use and they are holding up wonderfully well. Overall very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Annie R.

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe
customer_reviews.text: I am kind of picky when it comes to basketball shoes, especially when it comes to how they are shaped. Because if it doesn't match the contour of your foot it can increase the amount of ankle sprains. These shoes I have been using for over a year, and I have not had a problem with them. They have nice ankle support, and are durable. Good shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Troy McCaman

customer_reviews.title: i felt like my foot was going to pop out the sides ...
customer_reviews.text: ordered these and they were way to narrow. i have never needed a wide shoe but with these, i felt like my foot was going to pop out the sides of the shoe. 2 nd time with under armour. no more.

customer_reviews.text: Nice shoes! Purchased these shoes for my son who plays basketball in them. He likes them a lot, says they are very comfortable, provide good support and they do not slip on the basketball court. They seem to be holding up fine.

customer_reviews.title: Tight and Dont Breath
customer_reviews.text: As the header suggest, these shoes were way too tight. The material is too stiff. Also, nothing about the material is breathable. Prepare to sweat.

customer_reviews.title: First Impressions
customer_reviews.text: Just got these shoes delivered today. They look VERY nice and appear to be well made. However, as others have said, these shoes run small. If you wear a wide size, DO NOT order these shoes....period. I have a normal width and would not want these 1mm more narrow. Also, you MUST order them 1/2 a size bigger than your normal size. Had I ordered my normal size, my shoes would have been near impossible to get on when combined with the narrower width. Luckily, I had a heads up on both issues so I can't really complain BUT I can knock off a star.

GET A SIZE 0.50 BIGGER.. i usually wear 10.0 in Nike and i order this pair in a 10.5 and they fit wonderfully! i hope this review helps people.

product_meta.title: Under Armour ClutchFit Drive 2 Basketball Shoes
product_meta.description: Under Armour ClutchFit Drive 2 Basketball Shoes Tackle the court in the Under Armour ClutchFit Drive 2 Basketball Shoe. Updated ClutchFit technology wraps your foot with a lightweight, second-skin fit for powerful support. Charged cushioning resides in the midsole for responsive quickness while the multi-directional herringbone outsole delivers optimal court feel and control. ClutchFit Upper Under Armour have incorporated their signature ClutchFit technology into the construction of the upper to offer a lightweight, second-skin feel to ensure powerful support and incredible feel. With the upper being incredibly lightweight, it will not hold you back or restrict your performance on the court. A 3D moulded tongue forms around your foot and ankle to provide an enhanced fit to boost comfort while the full-length, moulded Micro G sockliner adds cushion and keeps your foot locked in place. Charged Cushion Midsole Exceptional cushioning is delivered thanks to the Charged Midsole. The midsole works to combine areas of cushioning and support to comfortably absorb impact, meaning whenever you land the risk of injury is reduced as the shock is absorbed and gradual wear and tear on the joints is diminished. Multi-Directional Herringbone Outsole Optimal grip and traction on court is provided by the multi-directional herringbone outsole, giving you the confidence to make sharp, aggressive movements typically associated with a high octane sport like basketball. A herringbone traction pattern is located throughout the outsole and ensures a full, unrestricted range of motion in all directions.
feature_bullets: Clutchfit upper for a snug fit
